text: I am looking to extract the number of rows on a HubDB query but I don't know if is possible...  ` {% set table = hubdb_table_rows(tableID, query) %} ` on something like this, I want to see if the results that I get are 0 or more rows.
You use the table info query not rows
I can't see any query filters that counts in HS docs :disappointed:

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/hubdb>
```
{% set table_info = hubdb_table(<tableId>) %}
{{ table_info.row_count }}
```
Should get you what you need.
but I have data in my HubDB
You're using the `hubdb_table_rows()` function, rather than just the `hubdb_table()` function. The latter should give you an object that allows you to retrieve the `row_count`
Or `{% if rows|count > 0 %}`, if you're testing to see if there are any rows
Saw an API error I've never seen before today: `Table [my-table-id] is already undergoing an full table write`
youâ€™ll see that if you try to publish tables too frequently
